page.title: 03WRITTLE AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE
page.content: The Agricultural College was founded in 1893 in Chelmsford but was moved to the present purpose built site in Writtle in 1940. It is one of the oldest and largest centres of agricultural education in the country. The college covers 210 hectares of farm, horticultural units and teaching units for the following departments: agriculture, horticulture, agricultural engineering, agricultural and horticultural science, management studies and extra mural studies. The farms cover a total of 150 hectares of a variety of soil types including boulder clay, brick earth, gravel and aluvium.
